what: A collection of code for qSIP analysis
title: A collection of code for qSIP analysis
text: R package quantitative stable isotope probing workflow. install:

title: Calculate Molecular Weight (Deprecated) — MW.calc
text: Calculate Molecular Weight (Deprecated)

title: Calculate Molecular Weight — MW_calc
text: Given data frame unlabeled treatment(s) specific taxon (.e., added heavy isotopes), calculate weighted average density (WAD), GC content, molecular weight, carbon content

title: Calculate Molecular Weight — MW_calc
text: df data frame includes x values (e.g., density DNA) y values (e.g., number copies) replicate IDs (e.g., tube number) density_column Column header fraction density (formerly vars[1]) copies_ul_column Column header abundance copy numbers (formerly vars[2]) tube_column Column header tube sample identifier (formerly vars[3])

title: Calculate Molecular Weight — MW_calc
text: data.frame following columns WAD: mean observed weighted average density replicate GC: guanine + cytosine content taxon's DNA MW: molecular weight (g/mol) taxon's DNA Catoms: mean number carbon atoms per nucleotide taxon Oatoms: mean number carbon atoms per nucleotide taxon Natoms: mean number nitrogen atoms per nucleotide taxon message: warning message listing replicates occurrences (.e., y values rep 0); value message "none" replicates present

title: Calculate Molecular Weight — MW_calc
text: assumes fixed GC content, molecular weight, carbon, nitrogen content taxon based mean observed WAD oxygen content fixed DNA regardless GC content weighted average density unlabeled DNA good proxy GC content taxon, according well-known relationship GC content density DNA (uses equation McHugh & Morrissey unpublished data) (NOTE: caused effect GC content molecular weight, negligible. caused differences relationship base composition binding water occurs CsCl.) Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel

title: Calculate Molecular Weight — MW_calc
text: requires function 'WAD_func'

title: All Taxa Calcs — all_taxa_calcs
code: all_taxa_calcs(   X.all,   comparisons,   output_directory,   M.soil = Sdat,   taxon_column = "taxon",   density_column = "Density",   copies_ul_column = "t.copies.ul",   tube_column = "unique.tube",   treatment_column = "unique.tmt",   soil_g_column = "g.dry.soil.tube",   growth.model = "linear",   prop.O.from.water = 0.6,   v.frac = 30,   copies.cell = 6,   pgC.cell = 0.1,   CI = 0.9,   draws = 1000,   tailed.test = 1 )

title: All Taxa Calcs — all_taxa_calcs
text: X.data frame data taxa treatments comparisons data frame specifying treatments compare; must contain columns: "comparisonID", "iso.compare", "trt.code.1", "trt.code.2", "trt.refs", "days" output_directory Directory write output files M.soil data frame mass soil replicate; must contain two columns, one replicate ID one mass soil; default NULL meaning M.soil provided, WAD ape results returned taxon_column column taxon IDs (formerly vars[1]) density_column column density data (formerly #vars[2]) copies_ul_column column abundance copy number data (formerly vars[3]) tube_column column tube sample IDs (formerly vars[4]) treatment_column column treatment IDs (formerly vars[5]) soil_g_column column soil weight (formerly vars[6]) growth.model model use calculating growth ("linear" "exponential") prop.O..water proportion oxygen atoms DNA come environmental water v.frac volume fraction within tube (uL) copies.cell assumed number 16S copies per cell pgC.cell assumed mass carbon per cell (units: picograms) CI confidence interval (0-1) draws number bootstrap iterations tailed.test specifies whether 2-tailed 1-tailed permutation test performed calculating p-value; default 2; note: 1-tailed specified, function assumes group 2 (trt.code.2) 'heavy' treatment group 1 (trt.code.1) 'light' treatment

title: All Taxa Calcs — all_taxa_calcs
text: list taxonID: identifier taxon (factor) comparisonID: identifier treatment comparison trt.code.1: ID code treatment 1 (factor) trt.code.2:  ID code treatment 1 (factor) wad1.obs.mean: mean observed weighted average density values tube (rep) treatment 1 wad2.obs.mean: mean observed weighted average density values tube (rep) treatment 2 wad1.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 1 wad1.boot.median: median bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 1 wad1.boot.CI.L: lower end confidence interval bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 1 wad1.boot.CI.U: upper end confidence interval bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 1 wad2.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 2 wad2.boot.median: median bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 2 wad2.boot.CI.L: lower end confidence interval bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 2 wad2.boot.CI.U: upper end confidence interval bootstrapped weighted average densities treatment 2 wad.diff.obs: observed difference WADs treatments (.e. subtracting mean WAD -- across reps -- group 1 group 2) wad.diff.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 wad.diff.boot.median: median bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 wad.diff.boot.CI.L: lower end confidence interval bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 wad.diff.boot.CI.U: upper end confidence interval bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 wad.diff.p.value: P-value (obtained permutation test); probability observing difference treatments large larger observed difference, null hypothesis (treatments equal WADs) true ape.obs: observed excess atom fraction based two treatments comparison ape.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped excess atom fraction values ape.boot.median: median bootstrapped excess atom fraction values ape.boot.CI.L: lower confidence intervals bootstrapped excess atom fraction values ape.boot.CI.U: upper confidence intervals bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values r.boot.CI.L: lower confidence intervals bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values r.boot.CI.U: upper confidence intervals bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values f.obs: observed carbon flux based two treatments comparison f.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped carbon flux values f.boot.median: median bootstrapped carbon flux values f.boot.CI.L: lower confidence intervals bootstrapped carbon flux values f.boot.CI.U: upper confidence intervals bootstrapped carbon flux values N1.obs.mean: mean observed abundances tube (rep) treatment 1 N2.obs.mean: 2 N.obs.mean: mean observed abundances tube (rep) treatments 1 2 N.boot.mean: mean bootstrapped abundances treatments 1 2 N.boot.median: median bootstrapped abundances treatments 1 2 N.boot.CI.L: lower end confidence interval bootstrapped abundances treatments 1 2 N.boot.CI.U: upper end confidence interval bootstrapped abundances treatments 1 2 message: warning message listing replicates bootstrapped_wad2.txt bootstrapped_wad_diff.txt bootstrapped_ape.txt bootstrapped_r.txt bootstrapped_C_fluxes.txt bootstrapped_N1.txt bootstrapped_N2.txt bootstrapped_N.txt

title: All Taxa Calcs — all_taxa_calcs
text: taxa, calculate growth rates, carbon fluxes, abundances, excess atom fraction, return statistics assess whether means weighted average density (WAD) differ significantly treatments written files, values quantities specified name data frame, columns individual bootstrap samples (.e., mean resampled data single iteration) rows correspond different taxa treatment comparisons Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel

title: All Taxa Calcs — all_taxa_calcs
text: requires functions 'WAD.func', 'boot.TUBE.func', 'diff.wad.calc', 'MW.calc', 'ape.calc', 'r.calc', 'f.calc', & 'comparison.message' implemented yet: include argument specify quantities user wants calculated e.g., ('wad.diff', 'ape', 'f', 'r', '') (inputs needed certain quantities) M.soil provided, WAD ape results returned; M.soil provided results (WAD, ape, r, f, N) returned treatment code names contain spaces treatments comparisons data frame (columns trt.code.1, trt.code.2, trt.refs) can separated semicolons, commas, spaces (combination semicolons spaces commas spaces) comparisons data frame imported csv file, using commas separate reference treatments may problematic unless quoting used (recommend using tab-delimited text files import) function (along ape, r, f) handle comparing doubly-labeled treatments (yet) 'copies' really 'copies.ul' units abundance (N) copies/unit medium, unit medium specified vars[6] (.e., mass soil: 'g.soil' default)

title: Calculate APE (Deprecated) — ape.calc
text: Calculate APE (Deprecated)

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
text: Given two treatments, returns estimate (uncertainty) excess atom fraction (atom percent excess) heavy isotope.

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
code: ape_calc(   X.light,   X.heavy,   boot.out.light,   boot.out.heavy,   MW.out,   iso.compare,   var = "trt.code",   CI = 0.9 )

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
text: X.light data frame data treatment 1, unlabeled, 'light', treatment X.heavy data frame data treatment 2, labeled, 'heavy', treatment boot..light list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func 'light' treatment (corresponding X.light) boot..heavy list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func 'heavy' treatment (corresponding X.heavy) MW.data frame containing output MW.calc unlabeled treatment(s) taxon iso.compare code specifying isotopes compared; "13C" specifies comparison 13C (heavy) vs 12C (light) treatments; "18O" specifies comparison 18O (heavy) vs 16O (light) treatments; "15N" specifies comparison 15N (heavy) vs 14N (light) treatments; value returns error var variable name treatment ID columns data frames CI confidence interval (0-1)

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
text: list boot.apes: vector bootstrapped estimates excess atom fraction (unitless proportion) based two treatments obs.ape: observed excess atom fraction based two treatments boot.apes.mean: mean bootstrapped excess atom fraction values boot.apes.median: median bootstrapped excess atom fraction values boot.apes.CI: upper lower confidence intervals (defined argument 'CI') bootstrapped excess atom fraction values message: warning message listing replicates either 2 treatments (include reference group) occurrences (.e., y values rep 0); value message "none" replicates present (single character value)

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
text: Assumptions: * assumes fixed GC content, molecular weight, carbon, nitrogen content taxon based mean observed WAD * oxygen content fixed DNA regardless GC content * weighted average density unlabeled DNA good proxy GC content taxon, according well-known relationship GC content density DNA (Schildkraut et al. 1962) * (NOTE: caused effect GC content molecular weight, negligible. caused differences relationship base composition binding water occurs CsCl.) * change weighted average density 16S DNA molecule caused incorporation stable isotopes DNA * relative change weighted average density equal relative change molecular weight * (Incorporation stable isotopes alter binding properties DNA water CsCl gradient. properties really important affecting density, function GC content, change just heavy isotope incorporation.) Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel

title: Calculate APE — ape_calc
text: requires functions 'WAD.func', 'boot.WAD.func', 'MW.calc', & 'comparison.message' number reps need equal two groups

title: Calculate WAD Differences (Deprecated) — diff.wad.calc
text: Calculate WAD Differences (Deprecated)

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
text: Given two treatments, returns statistics assess whether means weighted average density (WAD) differ significantly treatments.

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
code: diff_wad_calc(   X1,   X2,   boot.out1,   boot.out2,   var = "trt.code",   CI = 0.9,   draws = 1000,   tailed.test = 2 )

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
text: X1 data frame data treatment 1 X2 data frame data treatment 2 boot.out1 list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func treatment 1 (corresponding X1; 'light' treatment 1-tailed permutation test specified) boot.out2 list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func treatment 2 (corresponding X2; 'heavy' treatment 1-tailed permutation test specified) var variable name treatment ID columns data frames CI confidence interval (0-1); default 0.90 draws number iterations permutation test tailed.test specifies whether 2-tailed 1-tailed permutation test performed calculating p-value; default 2; note: 1-tailed specified, function assumes group 2 (X2) 'heavy' treatment group 1 (X1) light treatment

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
text: list boot.wads1: vector bootstrapped WADs treatment group 1 (X1) boot.wads2: vector bootstrapped WADs treatment group 2 (X2) boot.diffs: vector bootstrapped difference WAD group 2 group 1 (calculated group2 - group1) obs.wads..group: data frame mean (across reps) observed WAD group boot.wads..group: data frame mean, median, CI-lower, CI-upper bootstrapped WADs group obs.diff: observed difference WADs treatments (.e. subtracting mean WAD -- across reps -- group 1 group 2) boot.diffs.mean: mean bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 boot.diffs.median: median bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 boot.diffs.CI: upper lower confidence intervals (defined argument 'CI') bootstrapped differences WAD group 2 group 1 p.value: P-value (obtained permutation test); probability observing difference treatments large larger observed difference, null hypothesis (treatments equal WADs) true message: warning message listing replicates either group occurrences (.e., y values rep 0); value message "none" replicates present (single character value)

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
text: Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel

title: Calculate WAD Differences — diff_wad_calc
text: requires functions 'WAD.func', 'boot.WAD.func', & 'comparison.message' names x, y, replicate ID, treatment ID columns two data frames must match exactly number reps need equal two groups test statistic P-value calculation difference means 2 groups (calculated group2 - group1) P-value estimates probability observed difference (group2-group1) extreme extreme expected group identities randomized

title: Calculate F — f_calc
text: Given two treatments incubation period, returns estimate (uncertainty) flux carbon biomass (units: picograms carbon per gram soil per day) based degree labeling heavy isotope

title: Calculate F — f_calc
code: f_calc(   X.light,   X.heavy,   boot.out.light,   boot.out.heavy,   MW.out,   iso.compare,   days,   var = "trt.code",   growth.model = "exponential",   prop.O.from.water = 0.5,   copies.cell = 6,   pgC.cell = 0.1,   CI = 0.9 )

title: Calculate F — f_calc
text: X.light data frame data treatment 1, unlabeled, 'light', treatment X.heavy data frame data treatment 2, labeled, 'heavy', treatment boot..light list containing output boot.TUBE.func 'light' treatment (corresponding X.light) boot..heavy list containing output boot.TUBE.func 'heavy' treatment (corresponding X.heavy) MW.data frame containing output MW.calc unlabeled treatment(s) taxon iso.compare code specifying isotopes compared; "13C" specifies comparison 13C (heavy) vs 12C (light) treatments; "18O" specifies comparison 18O (heavy) vs 16O (light) treatments; "15N" specifies comparison 15N (heavy) vs 14N (light) treatments; value returns error days duration incubation period days var variable name treatment ID columns data frames growth.model model use calculating growth ("linear" "exponential") prop.O..water proportion oxygen atoms DNA come environmental water copies.cell assumed number 16S copies per cell pgC.cell assumed mass carbon per cell (units: picograms) CI confidence interval (0-1)

title: Calculate F — f_calc
text: list boot.f: vector bootstrapped estimates carbon flux (picograms carbon per gram soil per day) based two treatments obs.f: observed carbon flux based two treatments boot.f.mean: mean bootstrapped carbon flux values boot.f.median: median bootstrapped carbon flux values boot.f.CI: upper lower confidence intervals (defined argument 'CI') bootstrapped carbon flux values message: warning message listing replicates either 2 treatments (include reference group) occurrences (.e., y values rep 0); value message "none" replicates present (single character value)

title: Calculate F — f_calc
text: Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel Assumptions: assumes either linear growth model ( Nt=N0+(rt) ) exponential growth model ( Nt=N0*e^(rt) ) note units r differ linear model (copies * day-1 * g soil-1) exponential model (1/day), flux calculations adjusted according model specified final units carbon flux (picograms carbon per gram soil per day) assumes fixed GC content, molecular weight, carbon, nitrogen content taxon based mean observed WAD oxygen content fixed DNA regardless GC content weighted average density unlabeled DNA good proxy GC content taxon, according well-known relationship GC content density DNA (Schildkraut et al. 1962) (NOTE: caused effect GC content molecular weight, negligible. caused differences relationship base composition binding water occurs CsCl.) change weighted average density 16S DNA molecule caused incorporation stable isotopes DNA relative change weighted average density equal relative change molecular weight (Incorporation stable isotopes alter binding properties DNA water CsCl gradient. properties really important affecting density, function GC content, change just heavy isotope incorporation.)

title: Calculate F — f_calc
text: requires functions 'WAD.func', 'boot.TUBE.func', 'MW.calc', & 'comparison.message' number reps need equal two groups

title: Calculate R — r_calc
text: Given two treatments incubation period, returns estimate (uncertainty) intrinsic rate increase (r, units exponential model: per day; units linear model: copies per day per g soil) based degree labeling heavy isotope

title: Calculate R — r_calc
code: r_calc(   X.light,   X.heavy,   boot.out.light,   boot.out.heavy,   MW.out,   iso.compare,   days,   var = "trt.code",   growth.model = "exponential",   prop.O.from.water = 0.5,   CI = 0.9 )

title: Calculate R — r_calc
text: X.light data frame data treatment 1, unlabeled, 'light', treatment X.heavy data frame data treatment 2, labeled, 'heavy', treatment boot..light list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func 'light' treatment (corresponding X.light); note linear growth model used, list containing output boot.TUBE.func required boot..heavy list containing output boot.WAD.func boot.TUBE.func 'heavy' treatment (corresponding X.heavy); note linear growth model used, list containing output boot.TUBE.func required MW.data frame containing output MW.calc unlabeled treatment(s) taxon iso.compare code specifying isotopes compared; "13C" specifies comparison 13C (heavy) vs 12C (light) treatments; "18O" specifies comparison 18O (heavy) vs 16O (light) treatments; "15N" specifies comparison 15N (heavy) vs 14N (light) treatments; value returns error days duration incubation period days var variable name treatment ID columns data frames growth.model model use calculating growth ("linear" "exponential") prop.O..water proportion oxygen atoms DNA come environmental water CI confidence interval (0-1)

title: Calculate R — r_calc
text: list boot.r: vector bootstrapped estimates intrinsic rate increase (per day copies per day per g soil) based two treatments obs.r: observed intrinsic rate increase based two treatments boot.r.mean: mean bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values boot.r.median: median bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values boot.r.CI: upper lower confidence intervals (defined argument 'CI') bootstrapped intrinsic rate increase values message: warning message listing replicates either 2 treatments (include reference group) occurrences (.e., y values rep 0); value message "none" replicates present (single character value)

title: Calculate R — r_calc
text: Written Ben Koch & Natasja van Gestel Assumptions: assumes either linear growth model ( Nt=N0+(rt) ) exponential growth model ( Nt=N0*e^(rt) ) note units r differ linear model (copies * day-1 * g soil-1) exponential model (1/day) assumes fixed GC content, molecular weight, carbon, nitrogen content taxon based mean observed WAD oxygen content fixed DNA regardless GC content weighted average density unlabeled DNA good proxy GC content taxon, according well-known relationship GC content density DNA (Schildkraut et al. 1962) (NOTE: caused effect GC content molecular weight, negligible. caused differences relationship base composition binding water occurs CsCl.) change weighted average density 16S DNA molecule caused incorporation stable isotopes DNA relative change weighted average density equal relative change molecular weight (Incorporation stable isotopes alter binding properties DNA water CsCl gradient. properties really important affecting density, function GC content, change just heavy isotope incorporation.)

title: Calculate R — r_calc
text: requires functions 'WAD.func', 'boot.WAD.func', 'boot.TUBE.func', 'MW.calc', & 'comparison.message' number reps need equal two groups
